      • getLogger

        public static Logger getLogger()
        Gets a logger whose category is the full name of the calling class. 
         Intended for use as:
 private static final Logger logger = TPAResources.getLogger();
        It is an expensive operation to determine the calling class, so avoid creating transient loggers with this.
        Returns:
        a logger

      • getLogger

        public static Logger getLogger(Class aInClass)
        Gets a logger whose category is the full name of the given class.
        Parameters:
        aInClass - the class for which a logger is being requested
        Returns:
        a logger

      • getCallingClassName

        public static String getCallingClassName(int aInLevel)
        Gets the name of the class calling the caller of this method. 
         E.g. for a stack trace as follows:
 A.a()
 B.b()
 C.c()
 TPAResources.getCallingClassName(n)
 For n = 0 "B" is returned; for n = 1 "A" is returned.
        Note that this is a fairly expensive operation!!!
        Parameters:
        aInLevel - the number of levels above the caller to extract
        Returns:
        the caller's class name

      • getCallingClassName

        public static String getCallingClassName(Throwable aInThrowable,
                                         int aInLevel)
        Gets the name of the class that created the throwable. 
         E.g. for a stack trace as follows:
 A.a()
 B.b()
 C.c()
 TPAResources.getCallingClassName(new Throwable(), n)
 For n = 0 "C" is returned; for n = 1 "B" is returned.
        Note that this is a fairly expensive operation!!!
        Parameters:
        aInThrowable - the exception to process
        aInLevel - the number of levels above the caller to extract
        Returns:
        the caller's class name
